data.title: A bit pricey but good
data.text: We asked around for restaurant recommendations, and "House Wine" and "Salt" were the 2 that kept coming up. Apparently they're owned by the same person. Salt was beyond our business budget. We walked in on a Wednesday night without reservations and were seated quickly. The place filled up shortly thereafter. It's noisy and wait staff didn't seem very knowledgeable. We had a caesar salad with chicken, a caprese salad [which they call 'tomato'], and carbonara. All were good, but if we come back, we'll likely try another place.

data.title: Lunch with lady friends
data.text:
While the food and the service is very, very good, it is a little pricey.
Our experience with some 16 to 18 girlfriends was very good and cannot say enough about the service.
Would definitely return for a special specialization

data.title: Friendly atmosphere
data.text: Chose this restaurant solely on reviews. Our server, James, was great. The food average. The wine was good, but I seldom find a wine I don't like!  Enjoyable experience.

data.title: Underwhelmed
data.text:
As an extended visitor to McAllen, I was given several restaurant suggestions to frequent during my 6 weeks here.  This was in the top five, and frankly I could have passed.  While the staff - very young, very millennial - was eager to please and most friendly, and while the service extended was quite good with delivery and execution, it was ruined with a rather "diner-like" initial greeting and explanation of food and beverage offerings.  Again, very nice, but a bit inarticulate, lacking sophistication one might expect based on restaurant name and reputation.

It was the food that completely underwhelmed.  At this price point one would expect a series of shared appetizers to be presented and prepared with current trend and creativity.  

Not!!  

It wasn't that they tasted bad - the food was good, but just average.  It has to do with claiming to be who they are, and having the leadership to make certain that the serving staff knows their product, and the menu is current, creative and delicious.

The ambience is appealing, and they mean to do very well.  But there is a need for an "in-service" training to add a little more panache to the presentation, and the chef needs to revisit - perhaps - the recent edition of Cuisine.  Just sayin'

data.title: Great cuisine, noisy place
data.text:
This mediterranean style kitchen has original and intense flavors to offer. The starters are very delicate, the wine selection is wide, the flatbread (actually, pizza cut off in pieces) is tasty.  We enjoyed very much the pork belly; we found the pastry covered brie too sweet, so we avoided the marmalade as much as possible; the prosciutto flatbread was delicious, the lamb chops were also very intense, with too much spices.
The décor is modern and youthful, but the noise was so intense we had to leave early. Large groups of young people laughing and talking over the loud music, in a room with no rugs, no clothed walls, nothing to absorb the noise were more than we could bear.

data.title: Good place
data.text: This is a decent restaurant,  it is always super busy. I had a drink though which was made with regular tap water. I don't know if it was a mistake but the tap water around here is not great you can taste it. On the food front I did like the risotto and salmon.

data.title: Pricy, excellent food
data.text: Very nice presentation of food. Pricy. Decent service but very noisy place.  Long wait on weekends. Lots of peoplecome here just to drink.  Good appetizer menu.

data.title: Great food and service!
data.text: Burger was great and so were the appetizers.  This is really a special find and has great atmosphere!

data.title: Great Service
data.text: This was a wonderful lunch experience.  The food and service were great. They were very accommodating with any meal request.  The food was fresh and tasty and well priced. This is a great place to meet up with girlfriends and have a nice meal!

data.title: Anniversary Dinner
data.text: We have never been disappointed when we visit House Wines. Dinner was excellent and good choice of wines and drinks.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Loved the fresh, fun menu.  Great selection of wines (and beer too) plus if you get a bottle to-go it's 40% off!

data.title: Best wine and food
data.text: The ambiance in this cute bistro type place is very laid back and cozy.... Excellent food.. Perfect appetizers .. Loved the lime grilled shrimp.. Sooooo yummy paired with a chilled white a definite must for a girls night out.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: Excellent service and food. A good wine selection. Additional to this you can make reservations on line!!! I went to celebrate my husbands b-day and told the host about it when I made the reservation, and since my husband got in they greet him, and found on the table a happy bday card signed by all the crew. They really check every detail. Do you love cheese cake?? Well they have the best one! Much better than the one in cheese cake factory! You don't believe me? Go and try it. I love it.

data.title: Is OK
data.text:
It was OK but I was expecting something better.
They took to long to get to our table, other than that the service was ok.

data.title: Fantastic Wine Bar in McAllen
data.text:
Great selection of wines. Met the manager Eric & he expressed his support of Texas food, brews & Texas wines & is looking forward to putting more Texas wines on his wine list. 

Very nice menu reasonably priced. Outstanding service. Very convenient location.

data.title: Fannnnncy
data.text: The menu had a great selection of unique, fresh, and interesting items! I tried the duck and it was good. The drink selection was great as well. After reading some of the reviews, I decided to try the tincho and I'm glad I did. Nice combination of sweet and citrusy. The strawberry Bellini was also great (sweet but not too sweet). The sangria ... well I've had better.  It does seem to be a big social place so maybe make reservations.

data.title: Amazing food experience, romantic atmosphere
data.text: My fiance surprised me with an amazing dinner here for our one year anniversary. I have to say, it's one of the most unique and delicious restaurants in the Rio Grande Valley. We loved absolutely everything about the restaurant including the food, cheese platters, champagne and the wonderful ambience. I can't wait to go there again!

data.title: Un-impressed.
data.text: A friend and I went here for lunch. Not impressed! Very small amt. of wine for a very high price. The food was expensive and very average. Would not go here again.

data.title: Saturday night
data.text: Always reliable. McAllen ranch burger and Yahweh salad are favorites.  Tincho to drink can't be beat.  Opentable best way to get a table. Gets busy. Half price on bottles of wine if train goes by.

data.title: Perfect place to take your special someone!
data.text:
My wife & I went for Valentines's dinner. The wait staff is super friendly and the owner comes by to check how things are going. Food was delicious, service was impeccable, and vibe was on point!

Definitely a nice place to take a special someone!
